result.execSummary:
The defendant NIKO D POCAN was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are not a condition of probation & are to be paid directly to the Shawano Co Clerk of Court office within 30 days.  Debts older than 60 days will be processed for tax intercept & civil judgments.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Payment plans available for qualifying amounts.

Give DNA sample.
AODA and follow through.  Any other counseling determined by agent.
Absolute sobriety, no illegal drugs, only prescription medication with a valid prescription. 
No entry into any Class B licensed establishments. 
No contact with known drug users and sellers except in a treatment setting.
Maintain full-time employment or school or 5 job search contacts per week.

timeConds.notes: Court ordered 121 days credit to be applied to the conditional jail time.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. NIKO D POCAN

records.addlTxt: Shawano County DNA Proof of Submission - already on file

1:15 PM Prosecuting attorney Joseph J. Kaupie in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant NIKO D POCAN in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Kolell in court for NIKO D POCAN.   Plea questionnaire received and reviewed.  ADA Kaupie recites the State's recommendation.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest. Court advises party of their rights, gives citizenship/deportation admonition, finds factual basis, accepts defendant's waiver of their rights, the plea made, and finds guilty. Remarks by Atty. Kaupie and Atty. Kolell regarding sentence.  Defendant makes a statement.  Court makes its findings and pronounces sentence.  Appeal rights given.

9:49 AM Atty. Joseph Kaupie appears for the State.  Defendant appears by Zoom, in custody with his attorney, Matthew Kolell.  Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 12, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Pre-trial conference on April 1, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Final pre-trial on April 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:37 AM Defendant NIKO D POCAN in court with attorney Matthew Kolell.  Defendant NIKO D POCAN in custody.  Joseph J. Kaupie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendat waives reading of the Information and enters NG plea.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 1, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
